ggeasy
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • `ggplot2` Shortcuts

Easily add ggplot labels using label attribtute of `data.frame` column

Applies same logic as labs but uses as default the column label attribute if present as the variable label in the plot.

easy_labs(...)

Arguments

...

A list of new name-value pairs. The name should either be an aesthetic, or one of "title", "subtitle", or "caption"

Examples


require(ggplot2)
iris_labs <- iris
lbl <- c('Sepal Length', 'Sepal Width', 'Petal Length', 'Petal Width', 'Flower Species')
labelled::var_label(iris_labs) <- split(lbl,names(iris_labs))

p <- ggplot(iris_labs,aes(x=Sepal.Length,y=Sepal.Width))+
  geom_line(aes(colour=Species))

p
p + easy_labs()
p + easy_labs(subtitle='mysubtitle', x='x axis label')

Contents
